H0.text: Freezing is the term for something changing from water to ice.

H1.text: Evaporation is the term for something changing from water to ice.

H2.text: Boiling is the term for something changing from water to ice.

H3.text: Melting is the term for something changing from water to ice.

A4.text: Freezing point of a solvent is depressed when another compound is added, meaning that a solution has a lower freezing point than a pure solvent.

A5.text: The melting point of a substance is the temperature at which it changes state from solid to liquid.
